result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor Anthony Spinks Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Discharge Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs/surcharges/victim witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision on cases 14CF1813 and 14CF2357.  If not paid, a civil judgment.  DV surcharge does not apply.
Concurrent with: *6/17/2019  Judge T.  Christopher Dee.  Amended:  Concurrent with count three on case 14CF2357 and consecutive to case 14CF1813.

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (35 pages) commencing 01/16/15 by Leposava Munns.

Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. spc

Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($2,000.00) ad

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alternative Presentence report reviewed.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by: Tammy Goodman. 
  
AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to count #3 on case 2014CF2357) and CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF813 and count #1 on case 2014CF1813), in the House of Correction with credit for 21 days time served.  

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, as a condition of extended supervision (on cases 2014CF1813 and 2014CF2357), or if not paid, a CIVIL JUDGMENT. --- dv surcharge does not apply. 
  
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.   mld

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information received and filed.  AS TO COUNT 4 PER THE AMENDED INFORMATION FILED: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.20(1)(d), a Class A Misd.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 01-16-2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred for Plea hearing in branch 7.   mld

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant does not wish to proceed with plea hearing.  State withdraws the Amended Information for case 2014CF679.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 10-21-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 11-10-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld
addressed to the court from defendant, received and filed.   mld
with all previous conditions of bail continued.   mld
Court ordered the following new condition of bail: Defendant is not allowed to have any contact with ADA Nicolas Heitman, directly or indirectly.   mld

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Thomas E. Harris.  Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
All discovery received by defense counsel.  As a new condition of bail, Court ordered that the defendant is not allowed to have any contact with ADA Nicolas Heitman, directly or indirectly.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-27-2014 at 8:30 am.  Court finding probable cause, based on the two new cases, ordered forfeiture of the cash bail in the amount of $2,000.00 be forfeited on 2014CF679.   mld
with TOT to Justice Point, with all prior conditions of bail continued.  mld

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Thomas E Harris.  Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in custody.  
Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Warrant withdrawn by the Court.  State moves for an increase to the cash bail.  Court ordered cash bail in the amount of $5,000.00.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 7-8-2014 at 8:30 am.  All condition of bail are continued in full force, per the Court.  mld
Discharge Summary Report from Justice Point, received and filed   mld
DEFENDANT TO BE REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.   mld

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks not in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court is in receipt of a violation report from Justice Point for defendant, that on 4-28-2014, at 10:28 pm, the defendants' gps device triggered a strap tamper alert.  On Tuesday 4-29-2014, Justice Point spoke via telephone with defendant, at which time he admitted to have partially cut his strap to relieve pressure from a swollen ankle.  Defendant reported that his device remains on his ankle at this time.  Defendant was then ordered to report to the Justice Point office immediately for inspection of his gps equipment.  

ADA Heitman contacted Nicole Pritzlaff, from Justice Point, and was advised that defendant had indicated that he would be leaving the State.  For the reasons as stated on the record, based on the failure of the defendant to comply with conditions of gps supervision, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.  Attorney Tom Harris returned telephone call to the clerk and was advised of the action taken by the Court.   Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 6-9-2014 at 8:30 am, branch 4.   mld
Court ordered gps release as follows:  laundry (1 x per week, 2 hours), grocery shopping (1 x per week, 1 hour), verified job interiview and employment hours if verified.   mld
Defense motion to modify conditions of gps is heard and granted by the Court.  release laundry e, grocery shopping 1 per , verified interview, if get job release for work hours if verified.

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Thomas E. Harris.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense counsel received discovery and a new offer from the State.  Defense rejected the new offer from the State, and is requesting a date for trial.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-9-2014 at 8:30 am.  The no contact order, no guns, absolute sobriety and no violations of the law are continued until further order of the Court.  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Thomas E. Harris.  Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Andrew Matthews.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State will forward discovery to defense counsel.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-26-2014 at 8:30 am.    mld
to Modify Bail, from defense, received and filed.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Victor Anthony Spinks in custody.  Andrew Maier appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
